title: UnitedHealthcare Autism Coverage
shortDescription: One of the largest health insurers offering comprehensive autism coverage including ABA therapy, speech, OT, and diagnostic services in Florida.
description: UnitedHealthcare is one of the largest health insurance providers in the United States with extensive coverage in Florida. They offer comprehensive autism coverage including Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy, speech therapy, occupational therapy, and diagnostic evaluations. Coverage varies by plan type (employer, individual, or Medicaid managed care). UnitedHealthcare employs case managers and care coordinators to help families access autism services.
whatIsCovered: ABA therapy - typically 25-40 hours per week when medically necessary
Autism diagnostic evaluations and ADOS testing
Speech therapy, occupational therapy, physical therapy
Mental health counseling and psychiatric services
Applied behavior analysis supervision and reassessment
howItWorks: Check if your plan covers autism services (most FL plans required to by law)
Get autism diagnosis from qualified provider
Request prior authorization for therapies (typically handled by your provider)
Choose in-network providers to minimize out-of-pocket costs
Submit claims or providers bill directly

typicalCosts.monthly_premium: Varies widely by plan ($200-$1,500+/month for families)

floridaSpecificInfo: Florida mandates autism coverage for children under 18 (up to $36,000/year for ABA)
UnitedHealthcare has large provider networks across Florida
Available as employer insurance, individual marketplace plans, and Medicaid managed care
UnitedHealthcare Community Plan manages Medicaid in many Florida counties
Autism Resource Specialists available to help coordinate care
importantNotes: Prior authorization required for ABA therapy and most therapies
Annual ABA coverage limits vary by plan ($36,000 minimum for FL policies covering children)
Must use in-network providers for best coverage
Some plans require diagnosis from specific provider types
Out-of-network coverage may be available with higher costs

commonQuestions.question: Does UnitedHealthcare cover ABA therapy in Florida?
commonQuestions.answer: Yes, UnitedHealthcare plans in Florida must cover ABA therapy for children under 18, with annual minimums of $36,000 per Florida law.

commonQuestions.question: Do I need prior authorization for ABA therapy?
commonQuestions.answer: Yes, prior authorization is required. Your ABA provider will typically submit this request with your child's assessment and treatment plan.

commonQuestions.question: How do I find in-network autism providers?
commonQuestions.answer: Use the provider search tool on UnitedHealthcare.com or call member services. You can also ask providers directly if they accept your plan.

commonQuestions.question: What if my claim is denied?
commonQuestions.answer: You have the right to appeal. Contact UnitedHealthcare member services and work with your provider to submit medical necessity documentation.

learnMore.description: Information about UnitedHealthcare's autism coverage, resources, and how to access care coordination services.
